Presence of tools or configurations indi.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4688 for creation of known network sniffing tools (e.g., Wireshark, tcpdump, kismet). Analyze Zeek conn.log for unusual outbound connections from hosts running these processes. Use correlation analysis to link process creation events with network traffic patterns.

Detection of ARP spoofing or gratuitous.Action: Monitor Zeek arp.log for gratuitous ARP broadcasts or conflicting ARP entries. Detect multiple ARP responses for the same IP address from different MAC addresses within a short time window. Use time series analysis to identify bursts of unusual ARP activity.

Suspicious network traffic patterns sugg.Action: Analyze Zeek conn.log and http.log for unusual outbound data volume or connections to suspicious external destinations from hosts that might have captured data. Use descriptive statistics (e.g., byte volume per flow, frequency of connections to external IPs) and compare against historical baseline to identify anomalies.

Anomalous access attempts or activity on.Action: Monitor Zeek conn.log for connections on network device management ports (e.g., 22, 23, 443, 80) targeting network infrastructure IPs. Identify connections from unusual source IPs, times, or authentication failures (if visible in Zeek ssl.log or other relevant logs). Use frequency analysis and behavioral profiling based on historical data to flag anomalous management access attempts.
